column4: Does anyone have a suggestion for a media player for linux that can handle aacPlus, mp3, mpg, and DVDs?
totem-xine :)
Would that be different from "Totem Movie Player", which shipped with Ubuntu, or is it an add-on?
Do you know whether totem-xine will handle aacPlus, or just the others?
sudo adduser $USER nvram
That should do it; thanks.  For future reference though relating to my first thought, why would something revert like that?
/dev/is dynamically created on boot by udev
Ah, that would do it.
tmpfs is a filesystem in memory, so it occupies a part of your memory
Ah.
Do you know how to make suggestions to the development team?  (Sorry for the personal ask.)
that depends on the suggestion, feel free to PM me
Do you have to manually remove those all the time, or are they set to time out eventually?
manually
do you know?
I see your launchpad page says you wrote the FreeNX wiki page, do you know the answer to where in the menus nxclient would be?
applications -> internet
Hmm, not seeing it there.
did you just install it?
Yeah.
pkill -HUP gnome-panel
Beautiful.  (If a little disconcerting for a fraction of a second when things disappear.)
Shouldn't that little trick be included on the wiki page?
that you cryptographically signed the code of conduct
Who decides when we should call it morning in here?
no one, it's just that goodmorning sounds good ;)
That's true.  I suppose I wouldn't mind being wished a good day at dinnertime either.
ping
How do you do that little arrow?
Unicode
With what sort of input mechanism to accomplish that?  I'd like to do that sort of thing myself, and am curious what the steps are.
x-chat autoreplace
Ah, okay.  Any additional things that need to be installed?
gucharmap to pick characters
Okay, will look into that.
root404 is the registered nickname of an abuser...
Oh.
don't be too certain about the date - sabdfl wants to postpone
Oh yeah?  I hadn't heard anything about that.  What's up?
If it's after the 29th I have to wait for ShipIt, b/c that's when I lose my school internet and go home to dialup.
Do you have more info about what you said before?  I'm curious now.
check the mailinglist archive for ubuntu-devel-announce
Okay, where will I find that archive?
https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2006-March/000734.html
Thanks.
Understood, but what is the appropriate procedure for that anyway?
just ask around
and point people to official mirrors
I believe you were the one who informed me this was a known bug before; do you have a bug tracking URL for the problem with console switching with fglrx?
sec
Thanks.
Hmm, those have similarities to my issue, but aren't exactly the same.  I'm encouraged by "Fixed in Dapper" at the bottom of a linked bug though.
Did you make the bot forget Norway in your cleaning the other day?
'bout time there pal  ;)
Taken care of.
In that export command, what's the significance of 'CC'?  Custom compiler perhaps?
one sub version to be exact
Ah, thanks for the correction.
Ah, I'm lagged by 1.05 ;)
Very nice.
Did you just write that in the last few minutes?
s/few minutes/minute/
I'm impressed.
Is it theoretically possible to make something that would distribute all of your processing?
yes
Cool.  /me hopes someone does, and packages it for us :)
yes
you can set something in the .htaccess file, read apache docs for details (read: I can't remember the details ;))
As long as I know where to look.  Thanks.
v
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_autoindex.html
Should this take more than just creating a .htaccess for the directory and putting the line IndexOptions NameWidth=* in it?
.htaccess files should be enabled (iirc the default in Ubuntu)
Hrm...Doesn't seem to be doing it.  I must be missing something else.
hmm :/
do you get a 500 server error?
no, page shows up with the default width names still
hmmmmmmm
can the apache user read the .htaccess file?
Aha!  I think you're onto something.
www-data is the user, right?
yes
Still nothing.  Grr.
check the AllowOverride setting for the dir (although that should trigger a 500 error)
Okay, meanwhile, in /var/log/apache2/error.log, "[error]  [client 192.168.1.1]  client denied by server configuration: /var/www/.htaccess"  - the .htaccess I made is in a subdir.
Where will that be?  Main apache config file?
'grep -R AllowOverride /etc/apache2/*' - almost all results say AllowOverride None
I'm going to grab a shower, but let me know if you have any brilliant ideas.
Got it!  It was the AllowOverride - in the site-specific config.
nice
$HOME and $USER to be precise. And being a loginshell (so sourcing ~/.bash_login insteadof ~/.bashrc)
